metadata.title: Server Services Encryption Reference
metadata.description: Comprehensive reference of server services with OSI layer classification, ports, protocols, encryption algorithms, and supported cryptographic keys
metadata.author: NoSneak/XlogistX.IO Reference
metadata.port_format: Layer 4 services use ports (TCP/UDP/SCTP). Layer 3 protocols use IP protocol numbers.

encryption_format.description: Encryption field uses 'default/available' format for easy parsing

values.STARTTLS: Upgrade mechanism from plaintext to TLS
values.OSCORE: Object Security for Constrained RESTful Environments

examples.None/STARTTLS: Unencrypted by default, STARTTLS upgrade available

layer_classification.layer_3: Network layer - IP protocol numbers, no ports (ICMP, ESP, AH, GRE, OSPF, etc.)
layer_classification.layer_4: Transport layer - Uses ports (TCP, UDP, SCTP)

layer_3_protocols.description: Network layer protocols identified by IP protocol number, not ports

protocols.description: Internet Control Message Protocol - Network diagnostics and error reporting

encryption_options.notes: Can be encapsulated in IPSec tunnel mode

protocols.description: Internet Control Message Protocol for IPv6
Internet Group Management Protocol - Multicast group membership

encryption_options.notes: No encryption; relies on network isolation

modes.transport: Encrypts payload only, original IP header preserved
modes.tunnel: Encrypts entire original IP packet, new IP header added

encryption_options.notes: AH provides authentication and integrity only, NOT encryption

limitations.nat_incompatible: AH authenticates IP header including addresses, breaks with NAT

encryption_options.notes: GRE has no encryption; often combined with IPSec (GRE over IPSec)

common_uses.pptp: PPTP VPN uses GRE for data transport

protocols.notes: No cryptography; tunnel contents may be encrypted at higher layers

protocols.description: Open Shortest Path First - Interior gateway routing protocol

encryption_options.notes: OSPFv3 can use IPSec for encryption

protocols.notes: Authentication keys vulnerable; use IPSec for OSPFv3

encryption_options.notes: VRRPv2 uses weak authentication; VRRPv3 supports IPSec AH

protocols.notes: VRRPv3 with IPSec AH provides stronger security
No cryptography; relies on network isolation

alternative_transport.notes: Can run directly over IP (proto 115) or over UDP

protocols.notes: Transport layer protocol; see Layer 4 section for SCTP services

layer_4_services.description: Transport layer services using TCP, UDP, or SCTP ports

email_and_messaging.description: Simple Mail Transfer Protocol - Mail Transfer Agent
Internet Message Access Protocol - Mail Delivery Agent
Post Office Protocol v3 - Mail Retrieval

web_services.description: HTTP over TLS - Secure Web Traffic

encryption_algorithms.notes: Native VNC is unencrypted; use VeNCrypt or SSH tunnel

remote_access.description: Dell Integrated Dell Remote Access Controller

supported_keys.notes: Symmetric only - Grover's algorithm reduces effective security by half

authentication_identity.description: Terminal Access Controller Access-Control System Plus

encryption_algorithms.notes: Native encryption is weak - TLS wrapper strongly recommended

authentication_identity.description: Diameter Protocol - AAA for mobile networks

encryption_algorithms.notes: DEPRECATED - Use SFTP or FTPS instead

supported_keys.notes: Kerberos symmetric - Grover's reduces effective security
Session key derived - Grover's reduces effective security

encryption_algorithms.notes: L2TP has no encryption - must use with IPSec (L2TP/IPSec)

data_transport.notes: Data uses GRE (IP Protocol 47), not TCP/UDP

response_codes.4xx: Client Error (400 Bad Request, 401 Unauthorized, 403 Forbidden, 404 Not Found)

encryption_algorithms.notes: Unencrypted - Use DoT or DoH for privacy
Use NTS for secure time synchronization
No encryption - relies on network isolation
No native encryption - must use TLS wrapper or VPN

encryption_algorithms.recommended: IPSec or TLS for N2 interface

ip_protocol_numbers.description: IP Protocol field values for Layer 3 protocols

encryption_values_reference.description: Reference for encryption field values used throughout this document

values.STARTTLS: Upgrade mechanism from plaintext to TLS
values.OSCORE: Object Security for Constrained RESTful Environments

combination_format.description: When a port supports multiple encryption options, format is 'default/available'

examples.None/STARTTLS: Unencrypted by default, STARTTLS upgrade available
examples.None/SAv5: No default encryption, Secure Auth v5 available
examples.DTLS/SRTP: DTLS for key exchange, SRTP for media

timeline.2030: Web browsers/servers, cloud services must be quantum-resistant

tier_1_critical.description: High HNDL risk - immediate migration priority
